title: Quick Shoot Production from Sweet Potato

tasks.task: Produce sweet potato shoots and roots through slip production.
subtasks: Collect sweet potato tubers of different varieties.
Prepare plastic cups with tap water.
Cut sweet potato tubers into halves, identifying the top and lower ends.
Insert toothpicks into the cut ends to hold them in the water.
Maintain water level at 1 cm depth for two weeks to allow shoot emergence.
Check water daily and top up as necessary.
Observe and remove shoots after two weeks for rooting.
Transplant shoots into fresh water cups for root development.
Monitor new roots after one week and prepare for final transplant.

tasks.task: Prepare sweet potato slips for transplantation.
subtasks: Select shoots with sufficient root development.
Remove shoots from mother roots carefully.
Transfer rooted shoots into growing media or plant beds.
